00029 from PyQt4.QtCore import *
00030 from PyQt4.QtGui import *
00031 from PyQt4.uic import *
00032 
00033 from Koo.Fields.AbstractFieldWidget import *
00034 from Koo.Fields.AbstractFieldDelegate import *
00035 from Koo.Common import Common
00036 from Koo.Screen.Screen import Screen
00037 from Koo.Model.Group import RecordGroup
00038 
00039 (ScreenDialogUi, ScreenDialogBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('dia_form_win_many2one.ui') ) 
00040 
00041 class ScreenDialog( QDialog, ScreenDialogUi ):
00042         def __init__(self, modelGroup, parent, model=None, attrs={}):
00043                 QDialog.__init__( self, parent )
00044                 ScreenDialogUi.__init__( self )
00045                 self.setupUi( self )
00046 
00047                 self.setModal(True)
00048                 if ('string' in attrs) and attrs['string']:
00049                         self.setWindowTitle( self.windowTitle() + " - " + attrs['string'])
00050 
00051                 self.screen = Screen( self )
00052                 self.screen.setRecordGroup( modelGroup )
00053                 self.screen.setEmbedded( True )
00054                 if not model:
00055                         model = self.screen.new()
00056                 self.screen.setCurrentRecord( model )
00057                 if ('views' in attrs) and ('form' in attrs['views']):
00058                         arch = attrs['views']['form']['arch']
00059                         fields = attrs['views']['form']['fields']
00060                         self.screen.addView(arch, fields, display=True)
00061                 else:
00062                         self.screen.addViewByType('form', display=True)
00063 
00064                 self.screen.display()
00065                 self.layout().insertWidget( 0, self.screen )
00066 
00067                 self.connect( self.pushOk, SIGNAL("clicked()"), self.accepted )
00068                 self.connect( self.pushCancel, SIGNAL("clicked()"), self.reject )
00069                 
00070                 # Make screen as big as needed but ensuring it's not bigger than
00071                 # the available space on screen (minus some pixels so they can be
00072                 # used by dialog).
00073                 size = self.screen.sizeHint()
00074                 available = QDesktopWidget().availableGeometry().size()
00075                 available -= QSize( 180, 180 )
00076                 self.screen.setMinimumSize( size.boundedTo( available ) )
00077 
00078                 self.show()
00079 
00080         def accepted( self ):
00081                 self.screen.currentView().store()
00082                 self.accept()
00083 
00084 (OneToManyFieldWidgetUi, OneToManyFieldWidgetBase ) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('one2many.ui') ) 
00085 
00086 class OneToManyFieldWidget(AbstractFieldWidget, OneToManyFieldWidgetUi):
00087         def __init__(self, parent, model, attrs={}):
00088                 AbstractFieldWidget.__init__(self, parent, model, attrs)
00089                 OneToManyFieldWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00090                 self.setupUi(self)
00091 
00092                 self.setSizePolicy( QSizePolicy.Expanding, QSizePolicy.Expanding )
00093 
00094                 self.colors['normal'] = self.palette().color( self.backgroundRole() )
00095 
00096                 self.connect( self.pushNew, SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.new )
00097                 self.connect( self.pushEdit,SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.edit )
00098                 self.connect( self.pushRemove, SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.remove )
00099                 self.connect( self.pushBack, SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.previous )
00100                 self.connect( self.pushForward, SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.next )
00101                 self.connect( self.pushSwitchView, SIGNAL( "clicked()"),self.switchView )
00102 
00103                 group = RecordGroup( attrs['relation'] )
00104                 group.setAllowRecordLoading( False )
00105 
00106                 self.screen.setRecordGroup( group )
00107                 self.screen.setPreloadedViews( attrs.get('views', {}) )
00108                 self.screen.setEmbedded( True )
00109                 self.screen.setViewTypes( attrs.get('mode', 'tree,form').split(',') )
00110 
00111                 self.connect(self.screen, SIGNAL('recordMessage(int,int,int)'), self.setLabel)
00112                 self.connect(self.screen, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.switchView)
00113 
00114                 self.uiTitle.setText( self.screen.currentView().title )
00115                 self.installPopupMenu( self.uiTitle )
00116 
00117         def sizeHint( self ):
00118                 return QSize( 200,800 )
00119         
00120         def switchView(self):
00121                 self.screen.switchView()
00122 
00123         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00124                 self.uiTitle.setEnabled( not value )
00125                 self.pushNew.setEnabled( not value )
00126                 self.pushEdit.setEnabled( not value )
00127                 self.pushRemove.setEnabled( not value )
00128         
00129         def colorWidget(self):
00130                 return self.screen
00131 
00132         def new(self):
00133                 # As the 'new' button modifies the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00134                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by calling new
00135                 # in the parent model could make us lose changes.
00136                 self.view.store()
00137                 if ( not self.screen.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() ) or not self.screen.isReadOnly():
00138                         self.screen.new()
00139                 else:
00140                         dialog = ScreenDialog(self.screen.group, parent=self, attrs=self.attrs)
00141                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00142                                 self.screen.display()
00143 
00144         def edit(self):
00145                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self.screen.group, parent=self, model=self.screen.currentRecord(), attrs=self.attrs)
00146                 dialog.exec_()
00147                 self.screen.display()
00148 
00149         def next(self ): 
00150                 self.screen.displayNext()
00151 
00152         def previous(self): 
00153                 self.screen.displayPrevious()
00154 
00155         def remove(self): 
00156                 # As the 'remove' button modifies the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00157                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by calling remove
00158                 # in the parent model could make us lose changes.
00159                 self.view.store()
00160                 self.screen.remove()
00161 
00162         def setLabel(self, position, count, value):
00163                 name = '_'
00164                 if position >= 0:
00165                         name = str(position + 1)
00166                 line = '(%s/%s)' % (name, count)
00167                 self.uiLabel.setText( line )
00168 
00169         def clear(self):
00170                 self.screen.setRecordGroup( None )
00171                 self.screen.display()
00172                 
00173         def showValue(self):
00174                 group = self.record.value(self.name)
00175                 if self.screen.group != group:
00176                         self.screen.setRecordGroup(group)
00177                         if group.count():
00178                                 self.screen.setCurrentRecord( group.modelByIndex(0) )
00179                 self.screen.display()
00180 
00181         def store(self):
00182                 self.screen.currentView().store()
00183 
00184 # We don't allow modifying OneToMany fields but we allow creating the editor
00185 # because otherwise the view is no longer in edit mode and moving from one field
00186 # to another, if there's a OneToMany in the middle the user has to press F2 again
00187 # in the next field.
00188 class OneToManyFieldDelegate( AbstractFieldDelegate ):
00189         def setEditorData(self, editor, index):
00190                 pass
00191         def setModelData(self, editor, model, index):
00192                 pass
